newsitem.title: USA: U.S. CFTC settles with American Futures Group.
newsitem.headline: U.S. CFTC settles with American Futures Group.

text.p: The U.S. Commodity Futures Trading Commission said Monday that American Futures Group Inc and several of its officers agreed to pay restitution of $450,000 to customers to settle fraud charges.

The New York-based futures dealer, chief executive officer George Perk and president Thomas Reeves failed to supervise diligently the manner in which their employees handled accounts in their Aventura, Florida, office, the CFTC said.
Former Aventura branch manager Joseph Marchiano was also ordered to pay a civil fine of $10,000 and barred for one year from acting as an "associated person" with a futures firm.
Between September 1991 and January 1994, customers at the Aventura branch suffered losses of $5.1 million on deposits of $6.7 million, the CFTC said.
Marchiano failed to train employees in the branch adeequately and did not establish procedures to ensure that customer complaints would be fully investigated, the CFTC said.
In accepting the settlement, the firm and the officials neither admitted nor denied the findings, the CFTC said.
